alert.note: Alert for Boyd; Carter; Greenup (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 8:44PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Boyd, southwestern Greenup and Carter Counties through 915 PM EDT... At 842 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles north of Waltz, or 15 miles northwest of Olive Hill, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Grayson, Olive Hill, Carter Caves State Park, Load, Gesling, Greenbo Lake, Oldtown, Rush, Carter, Grahn, Hopewell, Brushart, Hitchins, Warnock, Soldier and Globe. This includes Interstate 64 in Kentucky between mile markers 150 and 180. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for northeastern Kentucky.
